She previously served as Chief Operating Officer at Albo, a leading neobank. She has extensive experience in investment banking and infrastructure investments through roles at Goldman Sachs and BlackRock. Ileana holds a Bachelor of Science in Actuarial Science from Instituto Tecnológico Autónomo de México. Jesus Lanza Sr. Advisor Jesús Lanza Losa is the Founder and CEO of Lottus Education, a tech-powered higher education consolidation platform in Mexico, serving over 80,000 students by providing innovative education solutions. Before founding Lottus, Jesús worked at Cerberus Capital as a member of the Special Situations Group in London, focusing on the Southern European market. He also held a position in Goldman Sachs' Latin American Investment Banking Division, where he worked on M&A. Jesús holds a Master's in Finance from the London Business School and has pursued executive education at The London School of Economics and The Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania. He also graduated in Business Administration from Universidad de Oviedo. Abelardo Loscos Sr. Advisor Abelardo Loscos is the Chief Financial Officer at Tangelo, a leading financial technology company. Prior to his role at Tangelo, Abelardo held key positions at Deutsche Bank and Citigroup, where he developed deep expertise in corporate finance, capital markets, risk management, and financial analysis, playing a pivotal role in driving business growth and managing financial risks. Abelardo holds a degree in Business Administration and Management from the Universidad de Navarra. With his wealth of experience across major financial institutions, Abelardo has consistently demonstrated leadership and strategic insight, making significant contributions to the organizations he has worked for, particularly in areas of financial structuring, capital allocation, and risk mitigation. Mauricio Bailléres Associate Mauricio Baillères is an Associate at Marea Group, specializing in investment strategy, corporate development, and financial analysis. He plays a key role in managing investor relationships, deal sourcing, negotiations, and portfolio company performance at Marea Group. He previously worked at Nubank, where he led initiatives such as evaluating M&A opportunities and launching the new debit card in Mexico, demonstrating strategic acumen. Mauricio began his career in M&A investment banking at Dadoo & Asociados and honed his expertise as a Summer Analyst at Fredericks Michael & Co., focusing on cross-border M&A and financial modeling. Ricardo Phillips Analyst Ricardo is responsible for conducting due diligence and market research at Marea Group. With a strong foundation in economics and data analysis, he specializes in extracting operational data from target companies and automating financial modeling processes. Previously, Ricardo gained experience in cloud architecture at Banco Santander, where he supported international data structure projects and implemented advanced data management solutions. Ricardo’s expertise in data analysis and financial automation has consistently enabled impactful outcomes across his roles. Maria Molina Associate Maria is a seasoned Investment Banker who began her career at Goldman Sachs as an analyst on the Healthcare team in New York, specializing in the diagnostics and biotechnology sectors. In 2023, she joined Marea as an Associate in the Investment Team and now leads the M&A vertical. Guiding due-dilligence and modelling efforts. With over three years of experience, Maria has advised clients on M&A and capital markets transactions. She leverages her extensive expertise to deliver impactful results in every deal. Enrique Lanza CEO Enrique is responsible for sourcing, structuring, underwriting and monitoring at Marea. Prior to founding Marea, Enrique invested $340M in industrial RE assets in the Midwest, US, being part of Aurora Industrial, LLC – a RE investment platform, backed by BTG Pactual and Chilean Family Offices. Enrique has had a 13 year tenure as Investment Banking Executive Director at Goldman Sachs and Director at Citigroup. Advised clients on tactical transactions representing over $50Bn of deal value while working in Mexico City and New York, covering North and South America. Serves as Director in Novadvice’s Investment Committee, Director in SEYSES, Investment Committee member in Aurora Industrial and he is mentor at Endeavor since 2012. Holds a B.A. in Business Administration from Universidad de Oviedo and a Leadership Program in Derivatives and Alternative Investments from London School of Economics.

Asia’s Best Restaurant Back Forward Pursuits Exclusive Carbone Owners Partner With Marea, a Rival Italian Dining Powerhouse The Major Food Group plan to expand the Marea brand worldwide. Facebook X LinkedIn Email Link Gift Expand Marea is now under the Major Food Group umbrella. Photographer: Liz Clayman Facebook X LinkedIn Email Link Gift Gift this article Contact us: Provide news feedback or report an error Confidential tip? Send a tip to our reporters Site feedback: Take our Survey New Window Facebook X LinkedIn Email Link Gift By Kate Krader January 25, 2024 at 4:40 PM UTC Bookmark Save For a decade, New York has had two competing Italian power dining spots. Downtown is Carbone, the celebrity-stacked, red sauce restaurant in Greenwich Village. Uptown, on Central Park South is the polished, cream colored Marea, the setting for countless C-suite meals both in reality and in shows like Succession . The two restaurants are now operating under the same ownership. Major Food Group, whose empire includes Carbone and the members-only ZZ’s Club in New York and Miami, are partnering with the Altamarea Group, owners of Marea . The restaurant will come under the MFG umbrella and be expanded globally, according to Jeff Zalaznick, co-founder of Major Food Group. Looks like you need to go shopping Join the flow90 foundations protocol for free SHOP Period Support PMS Elixir Merch SYMPTOM QUIZ SYMPTOM QUIZ Ingredients Ingredients Learn Periodicals The Flow State Podcast Cycle Alignment Cheat Sheet Downloadable Period Tracker About Us Flow State University Our bodies cry for help We were struggling Our hormones were creating chaos in our lives and we weren’t looking for band-aid solutions. We learned that the symptoms we were experiencing were our bodies crying out for help. We were looking for root cause, natural solutions—solutions backed by science and research—solutions that healed our symptoms. in all honesty We felt lied to Whether it was not fully understanding the side effects of our hormonal birth control or the wrong solutions for us being provided, we wanted more information—the good, the bad, the ugly. That’s why we believe in being fully transparent. From the science behind our ingredients, to the quality of our inputs—if you have questions, we're here for you. We believe in convenience Habits are hard When we landed on this nutritional solution it was in pill form—12 pills to be exact. We consider ourselves regimented, but we still couldn’t maintain that regimen. Our 21st-century lives are busy and we wanted a convenient, enjoyable experience—not a another thing on our to-do list. We developed our formula into a deliciously drinkable format and packaged it into individual servings—so wherever your busy life takes you, you can take us! We are dedicated to providing education, community and whole health solutions to women in all phases of their hormonal lifecycle. Founder & CEO Monica Grohne For 17 years of my life I suffered from severe PMS. PMS so bad that I thought I may be bipolar. With the help of leading OBGYNs, nutritionist, psychologist and my own obsessive research I found a whole health solution that provides real relief. I vowed to bring a convenient, efficacious multivitamin to all women suffering from PMS. I founded Marea on a mission to empower women through education and community. With us, there are no stupid questions and your symptoms are our symptoms. Welcome to your flow state. Medical Advisor Dana Pitman, MS RD CDN I am a Registered Dietitian/Nutritionist based in New York City with 10 years of experience providing nutrition counseling and education, wellness program strategy, and health promotion within the private, corporate, and healthcare industry. I believe strongly in the power of food to support health and strive to practice the delicate art of balance in both my personal and professional life. When I'm not working you’ll most likely find me at one of my favorite fitness studios, at one of the restaurants on my ever-growing list of city favorites, or bingeing on everything Bravo. Nutritional Advisor Jessica D'Argenio Waller, MS, CNS, LDN A licensed clinical nutritionist and an avid health writer and editor, Jessica produces women's health and wellness content that reaches millions of readers across various industry-leading publishers, including Brit+Co, Scary Mommy and Girls' Life magazine. She has been featured as a women's health expert on Bustle, Romper, Byrdie and Health.com. Medical Advisor Mandy Rother RD, LDN Mandy is a functional registered dietitian-nutritionist with over 10 years of experience. She was diagnosed with PMDD 15 years ago and her own story has included everything from dark rock bottoms to symptom-free years, along with navigating IBS, PCOS, and depression. Fed up with conventional band-aid solutions she decided to forge her own path. Trial and error early on led her to a path of studying and practicing integrative & functional nutrition. For the longest time she felt broken and at war with her body. When she finally stopped to listen to her body, she started to work WITH her body instead of against it. Over time, she was able to put her metabolic puzzle together for a comprehensive approach to relief. Today, she helps clients do the same. Learn more about Mandy on her website and follow along with her @pmdd.dietitian . MEDICAL ADVISOR Norah Candito, RD Norah is a Functional Registered Dietitian that specializes in Gut Health and Hormone Health. She is on a mission to spread menstrual empowerment to menstruating people of all ages. Her goal is to help you improve quality of life. Norah received her BS in Dietetics from Penn State, and her MS in Clinical Nutrition from NYU. She has had experience working in GI disorders in pediatrics at Boston Children’s Hospital, and has focused on GI + Hormone Health over the last 3 years. She is located in Hoboken, NJ with her husband and active pup, Blue. She loves to bike, hike, rock climb, play tennis, and loves any other activity in the sun. Connect with Norah on IG @nutritionwithnorah , or her website: nutritionwithnorah.com Naturopathic Doctor Paria Vaziri, ND Dr. Paria is a licensed Naturopathic Doctor in San Diego, California. She’s passionate about women’s health with her practice primarily focusing on natural hormone balancing. She’s determined to not only help individuals heal, but to empower and educate about the body and health in the process. When she’s not working with patients, you can find her unwinding with yoga classes or walks along the beach, cooking up new recipes, or exploring national parks. Follow her on instagram @doctor.paria or visit her website here . Monica Grohne Dana Pitman Jessica D'Argenio... Playa Largo Resort & Spa in Key Largo offers a luxurious and memorable escape, particularly noted for its beautiful beach and the opportunity for snorkeling . The resort's lush tropical landscaping and architecture create a paradise-like atmosphere, making it ideal for families seeking a fun-filled vacation and couples desiring a romantic getaway. Guests consistently praise the friendly and attentive staff, the well-maintained grounds, and the variety of activities available. To enhance your stay, consider requesting a room with a bay view for stunning sunsets and be sure to take advantage of the complimentary fishing poles and bait for a relaxing afternoon on the pier. Facilities & Amenities Guests appreciate the resort's numerous amenities, including a large pool with plenty of seating and a small beach area perfect for relaxation. The resort provides kayaks and stand-up paddleboards for rent, allowing guests to explore the surrounding waters. A fitness center is available for those looking to maintain their workout routine. The resort also offers a unique sunset celebration each evening, complete with a bonfire and the opportunity to cast away your sins. The presence of a giant chessboard in a courtyard provides a fun after-dinner activity for families and guests of all ages. The resort also offers complimentary fishing poles and bait , allowing guests to enjoy fishing off the pier. Cleanliness & Room Comfort Guests generally find the rooms to be spacious and comfortable, with comfortable beds and well-appointed decor. Many rooms offer balconies with beautiful views of the bay or the resort grounds. Some guests have noted issues with cleanliness, such as mold in the shower or dust in the room, indicating a need for improved housekeeping. However, many guests praise the cleanliness of the rooms and the overall property. The availability of bathrobes in the rooms is a welcome touch. Some guests have mentioned that the rooms could use some updating, but overall, the rooms are considered to be comfortable and well-maintained. Dining & Food Quality Most guests praise the breakfast buffet at La Marea, highlighting the variety of options and the attentive service. The Sand Bar by the pool offers delicious food and drinks in a casual setting. Some guests have found the food at Sol by the Sea to be inconsistent, with limited menu options. While some guests have enjoyed the restaurants , others have found them to be overpriced for the quality of food. The availability of in-room dining provides a convenient option for guests who prefer to dine in the privacy of their rooms. Some guests have mentioned that the restaurant hours are limited, with some closing as early as 10 pm. Location & Accessibility The resort's location in Key Largo is ideal for those seeking a relaxing getaway. The resort is easily accessible from Miami International Airport, making it a convenient destination for travelers. The resort's beachfront location provides easy access to the water and stunning sunset views. The resort is also conveniently located near local attractions and restaurants, allowing guests to explore the surrounding area. Some guests have noted that parking can be scarce, especially during peak season. The resort's location provides a peaceful and tranquil setting, away from the hustle and bustle of city life. Staff & Service Guests consistently praise the friendly and attentive staff , highlighting their helpfulness and willingness to go above and beyond to ensure a pleasant stay. Many guests have mentioned specific staff members who provided exceptional service, such as Edwin, Jacqueline, and Kadesha. The quick check-in process and the attentive service at the pool and beach areas contribute to a positive experience. Some guests have noted inconsistencies in service, such as slow service at the outdoor bar or delays in housekeeping. However, the overall consensus is that the staff is committed to providing excellent service. Additional Information Guests should be aware of the resort fee , which covers certain amenities and services. The resort offers a pet-friendly policy , allowing guests to bring their furry companions along for the vacation. The resort also offers a rewards program for loyal Marriott members, with some guests receiving room upgrades and other perks. The resort provides activities for kids , making it a great destination for families. Guests should be aware that the pool chairs can be reserved early in the morning, so it's best to arrive early to secure a spot. Periodismo independiente desde 2012. Seguir Ver los 90 empleados Denunciar esta empresa Sobre nosotros La Marea es una revista mensual en papel y un medio digital diario que apuesta por el periodismo riguroso y comprometido, especializado en el análisis, la investigación y la cultura. La publicación está editada por la cooperativa MásPúblico, 100% propiedad de sus socios lectores y trabajadores, lo que nos permite ser totalmente independientes de poderes políticos y empresariales.

La Marea surge de un naufragio: el cierre de la edición en papel del diario Público, el 23 de febrero de 2012. Cuando la empresa editora dejó de imprimir el rotativo de izquierdas, despidió al 85% de la plantilla. Un grupo de esos trabajadores, con el apoyo de cientos de lectores del periódico, se unió bajo el nombre de MásPúblico y trató de comprar la cabecera. Tras perder la subasta contra los antiguos dueños de Público, que recompraron su propio periódico por 500.000 euros, aquel grupo inicial decidió seguir adelante con su propio proyecto editorial y constituirse legalmente como una cooperativa. Durante esa primera etapa, se editaron dos ejemplares únicos (mayo y junio de 2012), con la cabecera Más Público. Tras un año de asambleas, debates y reuniones entre los socios lectores y trabajadores se eligió el nombre de La Marea para la nueva publicación, cuyo primer número salió a la venta el 21 de diciembre de 2012.
 
El proyecto pretendía abrir camino dentro de una profesión que no pasaba por sus mejores momentos: despidos colectivos, precariedad, influencias empresariales y políticas, autocensura y otros factores que han llevado al periodismo a vivir una de sus crisis más profundas, tanto laboral como de credibilidad. Por eso, en La Marea queremos reivindicar, con las palabras y con los hechos, el periodismo digno y verdaderamente independiente. Playa Largo Resort & Spa — Hotel Review | Condé Nast Traveler Skip to main content Newsletter Sign In Search Search Newsletter Inspiration Destinations Places to Stay News & Advice Curated Escapes Shopping Cruise Women Who Travel Video North America Chevron United States Chevron Florida Chevron Key Largo Chevron Review: Playa Largo Resort & Spa, Autograph Collection A welcome change from the Buffett-esque vibes that can dominate the area Readers Choice Awards 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024 Chevron Chevron Photos Save Story Save this story Save Story Save this story TriangleDown Review: Playa Largo Resort & Spa, Autograph Collection Multiple Buying Options Available Buy Now at Marriott Buy Now at Expedia Amenities Bar Beach Family Gym Pool Spa Rooms 177 Reviewed by Nancy DePalma What was your first impression of this hotel? Why did it catch your attention? This waterfront oasis—part of Marriott’s Autograph Collection—is a welcome sight after driving past one fast food outlet and tacky shop after the next on the Overseas Highway in Key Largo . The gleaming lobby feels more cosmopolitan than tropical. What’s the lowdown on the accommodations? What can we expect from our room? The rooms are stylish and contemporary with nary a seashell or palm leaf in sight. To some, this may feel out of place, but it’s a nice departure from the typical decor in this part of the world. Drinking and dining—what are we looking at? The resort has four bars and restaurants: Sol for a more casual meal, Las Olas for ceviche and sushi, the Sand Bar for a cocktail on the beach, and locally sourced La Marea, which has become a destination in its own right, for fine dining. And how was the service while you were there? Staff are friendly, if not the most efficient. What type of travelers will you find here? Marriott loyalists and vacationers looking for more modern comfort rather than over-the-top island vibes. How does the hotel fit in with other spots in the area? It’s a welcome and sophisticated alternative to much of what you’ll find in Key Largo. Is there anything we missed? Besides the rooms and suites, the resort has 10 bungalows and a beach house for groups and families looking for a little more space. You should also make sure to experience the spa during your stay. Bottom line: Worth a stay? It is. This Florida Keys resort is an elegant spot, as good for couples as it is for families.
